briefTitle: Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics (PK), Safety, and Efficacy of B/F/TAF in Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)-1 Infected, Virologically Suppressed, Pregnant Women in Their Second and Third Trimesters
officialTitle: A Phase 1b, Open-label Study to Evaluate the PK, Safety and Efficacy of B/F/TAF in HIV-1 Infected, Virologically Suppressed, Pregnant Women in Their Second and Third Trimesters

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Key Inclusion Criteria:

* The ability to understand and sign a written informed consent form, which must be obtained prior to initiation of study procedures
* With singleton pregnancy, at least 12 weeks but not more than 31 weeks pregnant at the time of screening
* Agree not to breastfeed for the duration of the study
* Currently on a stable antiretroviral regimen for ≥ 6 months preceding the screening visit
* Documented plasma HIV-1 ribonucleic acid (RNA) levels of \< 50 copies/mL for ≥ 6 months preceding the screening visit and have HIV-1 RNA \< 50 copies/mL at the screening visit
* Have no documented or suspected resistance to FTC, Tenofovir (TFV), or integrase strand-transfer inhibitors (INSTIs) including, but not limited to, the reverse transcriptase resistance mutations K65R or M184V/I
* Have a normal ultrasound, completed locally prior to the Day 1 visit, with no evidence of any fetal malformation or structural abnormality affecting either fetus or placenta
* Normal maternal alfa-fetoprotein level at the screening visit

Key Exclusion Criteria:

* Have chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV)
* Have active hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection
* An opportunistic illness indicative of stage 3 HIV diagnosed within the 30 days prior to screening

Note: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.

primary.description: AUCtau is defined as concentration of drug over time (the area under the concentration verses time curve over the dosing interval).
primary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: PK Parameter: AUCtau of Emtricitabine (FTC) and Tenofovir Alafenamide (TAF)
secondary.description: AUCtau is defined as concentration of drug over time (the area under the concentration verses time curve over the dosing interval).
secondary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: PK Parameter: AUClast of BIC, FTC, and TAF
secondary.description: AUClast is defined as the concentration of drug from time zero to the last observable concentration.
secondary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: PK Parameter: Cmax of BIC, FTC, and TAF
secondary.description: Cmax is defined as the maximum observed concentration of drug during the dosing interval.
secondary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: PK Parameter: Ctau of BIC and FTC
secondary.description: Ctau is defined as the observed drug concentration at the end of the dosing interval.
secondary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: PK Parameter: Clast of BIC, FTC, and TAF
secondary.description: Clast is defined as the last observable concentration of drug.
secondary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: PK Parameter: Tmax of BIC, FTC, and TAF
secondary.description: Tmax is defined as the time (observed time point) of Cmax.
secondary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: PK Parameter: t1/2 of BIC, FTC, and TAF
secondary.description: t1/2 is defined as the estimate of the terminal elimination half-life of the drug.
secondary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: PK Parameter: CLss/F of BIC, FTC, and TAF
secondary.description: CLss/F is defined as the apparent steady-state oral clearance following administration of the drug.
secondary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: PK Parameter: Vz/F of BIC, FTC, and TAF
secondary.description: Vz/F is defined as the apparent volume of distribution of the drug.
secondary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: PK Parameter: λz of BIC, FTC, and TAF
secondary.description: λz is defined as the terminal elimination rate constant, estimated by linear regression of the terminal elimination phase of the log plasma concentration of drug versus time curve of the drug.
secondary.timeFrame: Intensive PK: Predose, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 hours postdose in second trimester (Weeks 20-28), third trimester (Weeks 30-38), Week 6 post-partum, and Week 12 post-partum

secondary.measure: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 RNA < 50 Copies/mL at the Time of Delivery Using the Missing = Excluded Approach in B/F/TAF Group
secondary.description: The percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA \< 50 copies/mL at the time of delivery was analyzed in B/F/TAF group using missing = excluded approach. In this approach, all missing data were excluded in the computation of the percentages (ie, missing data points were excluded from both the numerator and denominator in the computation).

secondary.measure: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 RNA < 50 Copies/mL at Birth Using the Missing = Excluded Approach in Neonates
secondary.description: The percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA \< 50 copies/mL at the time of birth was analyzed in neonates using missing = excluded approach. In this approach, all missing data were excluded in the computation of the percentages (ie, missing data points were excluded from both the numerator and denominator in the computation).
